heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The nearest lightning strike ever noted was on 13 May 2025, at 4.97 miles distance.

storm.status: No stormy weather is anticipated.  The last big storm was recorded on 16 September 2025, lasting 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (213°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 3.9°C) and outside temperature (down 2.9°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 8%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 689 m) and light levels (up 6009 lux).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 3193 lux) and cloud levels (up 972 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 689.0m lower than yesterday, 350.7m lower than the past week, 972.1m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 702m to a maximum of 2980m, averaging 908.7m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1259.4m and 1880.8m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Expect overcast skies with low cloud.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, humidity should not be a concern and near calm conditions. Drizzle or light rain possible, overcast skies with low cloud, and a mix of sun and clouds. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.
